Take it with a grain of salt or maybe it's real. You decide.
 ===========================
 May. 13, 2005 1:31 | Updated May. 13, 2005 1:33
 Ya'alon: Bin Laden's location known
 By ARIEH O'SULLIVAN
 
 The IDF's chief of General Staff said in an interview published Wednesday that the location of al-Qaida leader Osama Bin Laden is known, and he is in hiding on the Afghanistan-Pakistan frontier.
 
 "I don't think that they don't know where he is. There are operational difficulties in putting your hands on him, for all sorts of reasons. But it is not true that they don't know where he is located," Chief of General Staff Lt.-Gen. Moshe Ya'alon told Maariv.
 
 Ya'alon, a former head of IDF Intelligence, said, "Ultimately, in order to get your hands on him you will need what we perfected and that is what we call 'targeted assassination.'"

IMO Bin Laden is dead and has been dead ever since the attacks on Tora Bora. I find it extremely odd that a media whore like Bin Laden hasn't shown his face in years now. It's not that difficult to get a camcorder and make a tape even if you're living in a cave.

I have a lot of respect for the IDF chief-of-staff, but I think he might be giving people too much credit. Who knows.
 
 I guess if the CIA manages to get Bin Laden and they know it was him with absolute certainty (if there is anything left of the body) we'll hear about it. Until then it's all speculation.
 
 The war on terror isn't just about one man, and it never was.
